New Records: Chris Sale set a single-season Braves franchise record for a left-hander with 197 strikeouts.
Key Match Events: Chris Sale won his major league-leading 15th game with six crisp innings.
Jorge Soler homered early and threw out a runner at the plate late.
Matt Olson hit an RBI double.
Luke Williams added a two-run double in a four-run seventh inning.
Chris Sale delivered two strikeouts and an inning-ending groundout with bases loaded in the fourth inning.
Post-Match Reflections: Chris Sale expressed enjoyment in having a fresh start with the Braves.
Manager Brian Snitker praised Chris Sale's ability to perform under pressure.
David Festa expressed disappointment in his performance, particularly the walk in the seventh inning.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Atlanta Braves moved within five games of NL East leader Philadelphia.
Minnesota Twins fell 3 1/2 games behind AL Central leader Cleveland.
